$description:
| What does this do? | Ensures external file sharing in Teams is enabled for only approved cloud storage services and that users can't send emails to a channel email address. |
| Why should you use this? | Ensures that only authorized cloud storage providers are accessible from Teams. Channel email addresses are not under the tenantâ€™s domain and organizations do not have control over the security settings for this email address. |
| What is the end-user impact? | Users will need to use organizationally approved methods for external storage integration and will not be able to email Teams channels directly. |
| Learn more | [Managing third party storage options](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-office-365/step-by-step-guides/reducing-attack-surface-in-microsoft-teams?view=o365-worldwide#managing-third-party-storage-options) [Restricting channel emails to approved domains](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-office-365/step-by-step-guides/reducing-attack-surface-in-microsoft-teams?view=o365-worldwide#restricting-channel-email-messages-to-approved-domains) |
